item.title: Games Workshop's Da Red Gobbo 2025 Miniature Has Holly Jolly Armor
item.content:encoded:
Games Workshop has revealed the design for Da Red Gobbo 2025 miniature. The tabletop studio continues its tradition of making a Christmas-themed miniature for Warhammer. This year's miniature brings good cheer and a robot suit to Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

Da Red Gobbo 2025 Miniature Announcement

In a recent Warhammer-Community post, Games Workshop announced Da Red Gobbo 2025 miniature. Much like past Christmas-themed gobbos, this year's miniature is packed with Warhammer's distinct visual excess. In this case, a goblin in a Santa outfit in a freshly stolen experimental suit of armor.

The miniature includes a free battleplan to use in your game. Your army either helps or hinders the jolly goblin from escaping the workshop of Niklozzar of the Ashen Beard. The "nice" player will get a defense boost while protecting Da Red Gobbo. The "naughty" player gets weapon buffs to help them shoot the little guy down.

As for the gobbo himself, his behavior on the battlefield is random. The reason? He doesn't know how the suit works. This means every turn, he pushes random buttons on the suit, causing different effects. Units might turn invisible. Hit and wound rolls might get re-rolled. Who knows? Certainly not the guy working the suit.

Da Red Gobbo 2025 is the latest announcement as part of Games Workshop's Grotmas Calendar event. This Advent Calendar-style string of holiday announcements has encompassed all of the studio's popular series, including Age of Sigmar, and the grimdark world of Warhammer 40,000.

The overall quality of these announcements has been mixed at best. They range from short fiction, seasonal painting tutorials, the introductions of the Helsmiths of Hashut faction to Age of Sigmar, new army detachments,, and new missions.

Nevertheless, Da Red Gobbo 2025 is a great reminder that, for all of the excessive violence, authoritarian nightmares, and existentially terrifying cosmic horrors that live in the Warhammer franchise, Games Workshop knows how to keep things light and fun during the holiday season.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. This… More about Tyler

item.title: Fantasy Life i Update Brings Roguelike Open-World Area and More
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Level-5 has released a new update for life sim RPG Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time, and it's got a brand new roguelike open-world area for you to explore, plus more.

As revealed in a news post on the game's official website, the update is now available across all platforms on which Fantasy Life i is available (although the versions are technically different between PC and consoles), so you can jump into Snoozaland right now if you'd like.

If you choose to do so, you'll need to find a new "suspicious tent" in the Base Camp during (or after) Chapter 3, and coming across it will allow you to explore a brand new open-world area in which you'll start at level 1 every time you re-enter, allowing you to test your might against a range of powerful enemies and bosses.

The update also adds the brand new Polishing feature, which allows you to use Fantasy Life i's crafting jobs to improve tools for other Lives. Doing so will give them a new aesthetic, as well as stat increases and the chance to trigger a boost effect during battle or minigames.

As you'd probably expect from a Fantasy Life i update, there are plenty of other changes as well, including an increased maximum number of Islander Houses you can build, as well as various other gameplay adjustments and tweaks.

You can check out a trailer for the Fantasy Life i Snoozaland update, which gives you a sense of what kind of new features and changes you can expect, right here.

The update comes on the heels of Fantasy Life i proving a (perhaps unexpected) success for Level-5; the game managed to sell a million copies within just a couple of weeks, and it's not Level-5's only success this year, either.

Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time is available now for PC, PlayStation, Xbox Series X|S, and both Switch 2 and Switch. The Snoozaland update is also out, and you can download it right now.
